name: Palindrome Checker
description: Determines if a string reads the same forwards and backwards using the two-pointer technique. This algorithm ignores spaces, punctuation, and case.
keyIdeas: Two-pointer approach - start from both ends
Early termination - stop as soon as mismatch found
Linear time complexity - single pass through half the string

complexity.timeExplanation: We traverse through at most n/2 characters, where n is the length of the cleaned string. Each comparison is O(1), resulting in O(n) total time.
complexity.spaceExplanation: Only two pointer variables are needed regardless of input size. The cleaned string is created once and not modified during comparison.

realWorldUses: DNA sequence analysis - identifying palindromic sequences in genetics
Text validation - checking usernames or identifiers for palindrome properties
Data integrity checks - palindrome-based checksums in some systems
Pattern recognition - finding symmetric patterns in data streams

examples.input: A man, a plan, a canal: Panama
examples.explanation: After removing non-alphanumeric characters and converting to lowercase, it reads 'amanaplanacanalpanama' which is a palindrome.
After cleaning: 'raceacar' which is not a palindrome.
